newsitem.title: UK: Tory defector says EU referendum "winning card".
newsitem.headline: Tory defector says EU referendum "winning card".

text.p: Lord McAlpine, the former Conservative Pary treasurer who has defected to Sir James Goldsmith's Referendum Party, said the Conservatives were "almost certain to lose" the election without the promise of a referendum on the single European currency.

He described Prime Minister John Major's policy on a single currency as "a philosophy of futility" and said the government should announce a referendum on Britain's membership of the European Union. "I think it's a winning card," McAlpine told BBC radio. He said he wanted the Conservatives to win the next election despite his own defection.
"I think without the promise of a referendum he (Major) is almost certain to lose," he said.
McAlpine said he wanted the divisive issue of whether Britain should join a single currency cleared up.

"Banks, businesses, all sorts of organisations have to make their arrangements. The country needs to know which direction it's going in. We can't say -- oh, we'll leave that -- this is a philosophy of futility," he said.
McAlpine is to chair the Referendum Party's first conference on October 19. Conservative Party chairman Brian Mawhinney sought to play down the defection, calling it an "irrelevance."
